name: identitytoolkit
title: Google Identity Toolkit API
description: Help the third party sites to implement federated login.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/firebase.description: View and administer all your Firebase data and settings

CreateAuthUriResponse.description: Response of creating the IDP authentication URL.

allProviders.description: all providers the user has once used to do federated login

authUri.description: The URI used by the IDP to authenticate the user.

forExistingProvider.description: True if the authUri is for user's existing provider.

providerId.description: The provider ID of the auth URI.

registered.description: Whether the user is registered if the identifier is an email.

sessionId.description: Session ID which should be passed in the following verifyAssertion request.

DownloadAccountResponse.description: Respone of downloading accounts in batch.

nextPageToken.description: The next page token. To be used in a subsequent request to return the next page of results.

GetOobConfirmationCodeResponse.description: Response of getting a code for user confirmation (reset password, change email etc.).

email.description: The email address that the email is sent to.

oobCode.description: The code to be send to the user.

recaptchaStoken.description: The stoken field for the recaptcha widget, used to request captcha challenge.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyCreateAuthUri.description: Request to get the IDP authentication URL.

appId.description: The app ID of the mobile app, base64(CERT_SHA1):PACKAGE_NAME for Android, BUNDLE_ID for iOS.

authFlowType.description: Explicitly specify the auth flow type. Currently only support "CODE_FLOW" type. The field is only used for Google provider.

clientId.description: The relying party OAuth client ID.

context.description: The opaque value used by the client to maintain context info between the authentication request and the IDP callback.

continueUri.description: The URI to which the IDP redirects the user after the federated login flow.

customParameter.description: The query parameter that client can customize by themselves in auth url. The following parameters are reserved for server so that they cannot be customized by clients: client_id, response_type, scope, redirect_uri, state, oauth_token.

hostedDomain.description: The hosted domain to restrict sign-in to accounts at that domain for Google Apps hosted accounts.

identifier.description: The email or federated ID of the user.

oauthConsumerKey.description: The developer's consumer key for OpenId OAuth Extension

oauthScope.description: Additional oauth scopes, beyond the basid user profile, that the user would be prompted to grant

openidRealm.description: Optional realm for OpenID protocol. The sub string "scheme://domain:port" of the param "continueUri" is used if this is not set.

otaApp.description: The native app package for OTA installation.

providerId.description: The IdP ID. For white listed IdPs it's a short domain name e.g. google.com, aol.com, live.net and yahoo.com. For other OpenID IdPs it's the OP identifier.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

idToken.description: The GITKit token or STS id token of the authenticated user.

localId.description: The local ID of the user.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyDownloadAccou.description: Request to download user account in batch.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

maxResults.description: The max number of results to return in the response.

nextPageToken.description: The token for the next page. This should be taken from the previous response.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyGetAccountInf.description: Request to get the account information.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

email.description: The list of emails of the users to inquiry.

idToken.description: The GITKit token of the authenticated user.

localId.description: The list of local ID's of the users to inquiry.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyGetProjectCon.description: Response of getting the project configuration.

allowPasswordUser.description: Whether to allow password user sign in or sign up.

apiKey.description: Browser API key, needed when making http request to Apiary.

projectId.description: Project ID of the relying party.

useEmailSending.description: Whether to use email sending provided by Firebear.

email.description: The email address of the user.

newPassword.description: The new password inputted by the user.

oldPassword.description: The old password inputted by the user.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartySetAccountInf.description: Request to set the account information.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the account is created.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

deleteAttribute.description: The attributes users request to delete.

deleteProvider.description: The IDPs the user request to delete.

emailVerified.description: Mark the email as verified or not.

idToken.description: The GITKit token of the authenticated user.

instanceId.description: Instance id token of the app.

localId.description: The local ID of the user.

oobCode.description: The out-of-band code of the change email request.

password.description: The new password of the user.

photoUrl.description: The photo url of the user.

provider.description: The associated IDPs of the user.

returnSecureToken.description: Whether return sts id token and refresh token instead of gitkit token.

upgradeToFederatedLogin.description: Mark the user to upgrade to federated login.

validSince.description: Timestamp in seconds for valid login token.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartySetProjectCon.description: Request to set the project configuration.

allowPasswordUser.description: Whether to allow password user sign in or sign up.

apiKey.description: Browser API key, needed when making http request to Apiary.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

useEmailSending.description: Whether to use email sending provided by Firebear.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartySetProjectCon.description: Response of setting the project configuration.

projectId.description: Project ID of the relying party.

instanceId.description: Instance id token of the app.

localId.description: The local ID of the user.
The local ID of the user.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartySignupNewUser.description: Request to signup new user, create anonymous user or anonymous user reauth.

disabled.description: Whether to disable the user. Only can be used by service account.

emailVerified.description: Mark the email as verified or not. Only can be used by service account.

idToken.description: The GITKit token of the authenticated user.

instanceId.description: Instance id token of the app.

password.description: The new password of the user.

photoUrl.description: The photo url of the user.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyUploadAccount.description: Request to upload user account in batch.

allowOverwrite.description: Whether allow overwrite existing account when user local_id exists.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

memoryCost.description: Memory cost for hash calculation. Used by scrypt similar algorithms.

rounds.description: Rounds for hash calculation. Used by scrypt and similar algorithms.

sanityCheck.description: If true, backend will do sanity check(including duplicate email and federated id) when uploading account.

signerKey.description: The key for to hash the password.

targetProjectId.description: Specify which project (field value is actually project id) to operate. Only used when provided credential.

users.description: The account info to be stored.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyVerifyAsserti.description: Request to verify the IDP assertion.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

idToken.description: The GITKit token of the authenticated user.

instanceId.description: Instance id token of the app.

pendingIdToken.description: The GITKit token for the non-trusted IDP pending to be confirmed by the user.

postBody.description: The post body if the request is a HTTP POST.

requestUri.description: The URI to which the IDP redirects the user back. It may contain federated login result params added by the IDP.

returnIdpCredential.description: Whether return 200 and IDP credential rather than throw exception when federated id is already linked.

returnSecureToken.description: Whether return sts id token and refresh token instead of gitkit token.

sessionId.description: Session ID, which should match the one in previous createAuthUri request.

IdentitytoolkitRelyingpartyVerifyCustomT.description: Request to verify a custom token

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

instanceId.description: Instance id token of the app.

returnSecureToken.description: Whether return sts id token and refresh token instead of gitkit token.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: GCP project number of the requesting delegated app. Currently only intended for Firebase V1 migration.

idToken.description: The GITKit token of the authenticated user.

instanceId.description: Instance id token of the app.

password.description: The password inputed by the user.

pendingIdToken.description: The GITKit token for the non-trusted IDP, which is to be confirmed by the user.

returnSecureToken.description: Whether return sts id token and refresh token instead of gitkit token.

IdpConfig.description: Template for a single idp configuration.

experimentPercent.description: Percent of users who will be prompted/redirected federated login for this IDP.

whitelistedAudiences.description: Whitelisted client IDs for audience check.

Relyingparty.description: Request of getting a code for user confirmation (reset password, change email etc.)

captchaResp.description: The recaptcha response from the user.

challenge.description: The recaptcha challenge presented to the user.

idToken.description: The user's Gitkit login token for email change.

newEmail.description: The new email if the code is for email change.

userIp.description: The IP address of the user.

email.description: The user's email. If the out-of-band code is for email recovery, the user's original email.

newEmail.description: If the out-of-band code is for email recovery, the user's new email.

SetAccountInfoResponse.description: Respone of setting the account information.

expiresIn.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be expiration time of STS id token in seconds.

idToken.description: The Gitkit id token to login the newly sign up user.

localId.description: The local ID of the user.

newEmail.description: The new email the user attempts to change to.

photoUrl.description: The photo url of the user.

providerUserInfo.description: The user's profiles at the associated IdPs.

displayName.description: The user's display name at the IDP.

photoUrl.description: The user's photo url at the IDP.

providerId.description: The IdP ID. For whitelisted IdPs it's a short domain name, e.g., google.com, aol.com, live.net and yahoo.com. For other OpenID IdPs it's the OP identifier.

refreshToken.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be refresh token.

SignupNewUserResponse.description: Response of signing up new user, creating anonymous user or anonymous user reauth.

expiresIn.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be expiration time of STS id token in seconds.

idToken.description: The Gitkit id token to login the newly sign up user.

localId.description: The RP local ID of the user.

refreshToken.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be refresh token.

UploadAccountResponse.description: Respone of uploading accounts in batch.

error.description: The error encountered while processing the account info.

index.description: The index of the malformed account, starting from 0.

message.description: Detailed error message for the account info.

UserInfo.description: Template for an individual account info.

customAuth.description: Whether the user is authenticated by the developer.

emailVerified.description: Whether the email has been verified.

localId.description: The local ID of the user.

passwordUpdatedAt.description: The timestamp when the password was last updated.

photoUrl.description: The URL of the user profile photo.

displayName.description: The user's display name at the IDP.

photoUrl.description: The user's photo url at the IDP.

providerId.description: The IdP ID. For white listed IdPs it's a short domain name, e.g., google.com, aol.com, live.net and yahoo.com. For other OpenID IdPs it's the OP identifier.

rawId.description: User's raw identifier directly returned from IDP.

screenName.description: User's screen name at Twitter or login name at Github.
User's screen name at Twitter or login name at Github.

validSince.description: Timestamp in seconds for valid login token.

VerifyAssertionResponse.description: Response of verifying the IDP assertion.

appScheme.description: The custom scheme used by mobile app.

context.description: The opaque value used by the client to maintain context info between the authentication request and the IDP callback.

dateOfBirth.description: The birth date of the IdP account.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

email.description: The email returned by the IdP. NOTE: The federated login user may not own the email.

emailRecycled.description: It's true if the email is recycled.

emailVerified.description: The value is true if the IDP is also the email provider. It means the user owns the email.

expiresIn.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be expiration time of STS id token in seconds.

federatedId.description: The unique ID identifies the IdP account.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

fullName.description: The full name of the user.

inputEmail.description: It's the identifier param in the createAuthUri request if the identifier is an email. It can be used to check whether the user input email is different from the asserted email.

language.description: The language preference of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

localId.description: The RP local ID if it's already been mapped to the IdP account identified by the federated ID.

needConfirmation.description: Whether the assertion is from a non-trusted IDP and need account linking confirmation.

needEmail.description: Whether need client to supply email to complete the federated login flow.

nickName.description: The nick name of the user.

oauthExpireIn.description: The lifetime in seconds of the OAuth2 access token.

oauthRequestToken.description: The user approved request token for the OpenID OAuth extension.

oauthScope.description: The scope for the OpenID OAuth extension.

originalEmail.description: The original email stored in the mapping storage. It's returned when the federated ID is associated to a different email.

photoUrl.description: The URI of the public accessible profiel picture.

providerId.description: The IdP ID. For white listed IdPs it's a short domain name e.g. google.com, aol.com, live.net and yahoo.com. If the "providerId" param is set to OpenID OP identifer other than the whilte listed IdPs the OP identifier is returned. If the "identifier" param is federated ID in the createAuthUri request. The domain part of the federated ID is returned.

refreshToken.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be refresh token.

screenName.description: The screen_name of a Twitter user or the login name at Github.

verifiedProvider.description: When action is 'map', contains the idps which can be used for confirmation.

VerifyCustomTokenResponse.description: Response from verifying a custom token

expiresIn.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be expiration time of STS id token in seconds.

idToken.description: The GITKit token for authenticated user.

refreshToken.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be refresh token.

email.description: The email returned by the IdP. NOTE: The federated login user may not own the email.

expiresIn.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be expiration time of STS id token in seconds.

idToken.description: The GITKit token for authenticated user.

localId.description: The RP local ID if it's already been mapped to the IdP account identified by the federated ID.

oauthExpireIn.description: The lifetime in seconds of the OAuth2 access token.

photoUrl.description: The URI of the user's photo at IdP

refreshToken.description: If idToken is STS id token, then this field will be refresh token.

createAuthUri.description: Creates the URI used by the IdP to authenticate the user.

getOobConfirmationCode.description: Get a code for user action confirmation.

delegatedProjectNumber.description: Delegated GCP project number of the request.

projectNumber.description: GCP project number of the request.

setAccountInfo.description: Set account info for a user.

verifyAssertion.description: Verifies the assertion returned by the IdP.

verifyCustomToken.description: Verifies the developer asserted ID token.
